The contraindication for Sumatriptan in patients concurrently using monoamine oxidase-A (MAO-A) inhibitors is related to the risk of serotonin syndrome. This is because MAO-A inhibitors can increase the levels of serotonin in the brain, and when combined with Sumatriptan, which also increases serotonin levels, it can lead to a potentially life-threatening condition known as serotonin syndrome.

[FinalAnswer] A: Increased risk of serotonin syndrome.
